contentList.content: Descendants of celestials of the Upper Planes, aasimars are a rare species often regarded as messianic figures throughout Faerûn. Faced with high expectations from society and divine interference with their thoughts and feelings, aasimars often must fight for control over their own lives.

Descended from crusading angels, Scourge aasimars inherit a burning hatred for the forces of evil and are driven to destroy it wherever it is found. They may tap into their angelic bloodline to burn their foes in holy fire.
Descended from guardian angels, Protector aasimars highly value mortal life and feel obligated to safeguard those around them. They may tap into their angelic bloodline to shield and heal others.

Descended from fallen angels, or having fallen themselves, Fallen aasimars have damaged their ties to the divine, and experience impulses to destroy good as much as protect it. Their divine abilities are twisted into something darker.

Descended from the most devout of angels and raised in the most strict of ways, Harbinger aasimars have strenghtened their resolve and piousness through penance for the sins of the general populace. Carrying the burdens of the world on their backs, they are a true reckoning.
You can see in ordinary darkness up to a range of [1].

Raised to be a Harbinger of pure Evil, this Aasimar resisted the brainwashing by a group of silent cultists. She roamed the lands for redemption which she eventually found, reborn as a Vigil and regaining her celestial voice.
Sin Eater's Meridian - Scourge by Dissidia
Sin Eater's Meridian - Protector by Dissidia
Sin Eater's Meridian - Fallen by Dissidia
Sin Eater's Meridian - Harbinger by Dissidia
The Sin Eater darkens your door...
Revert back from your celestial form.
Once per turn, you may call upon your celestial power to deal extra damage on a succesful attack.
The amount of times you can place a Mark.
You may bless yourself or a target to take [3] reduced damage the next time they are hurt.
You are blessed by a Vigil to take [3] reduced damage the next time you are hurt.

Your need to protect others manifests itself as divine power. You gain flight, and at the end of each turn, you and allies within 10 meters of you that you can see gain [2]. Once per turn, deal an additional [1] to one target when you hit with an attack or spell.
At the end of each turn, you and allies within 10 meters of you that you can see gain [2].
You may infuse yourself or a target with divine ire, adding an additional [1] to their next attack or spell that hits.
You are infused with divine ire by a Scourge of the Light, adding an additional [1] to your next attack or spell that hits.

Your righteous fury boils over. You gain flight, shed bright light in a 10-foot radius, and at the end of your turn, you and each enemy creature within 10 meters of you take [1]. Once per turn, deal an additional [1] to one target when you hit it with an attack or a spell.
At the end of your turn, you and each enemy creature within 10 meters of you take [1]. You also shed bright light in a 10 meter radius.

You may ward yourself or an ally with your inner darkness, forcing the next enemy who attacks them in melee to make a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag> for [3] turns.

You are warded by a Fallen Aasimar's inner darkness, forcing the next enemy who attacks you in melee to make a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag> for [4] turns.

Unleash the darkness inside. You gain flight, and at the end of each turn, other creatures within 10 meters of you that can see you must each succeed on a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag> of you until the end of your next turn. Once per turn, deal an additional [1] to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.

At the end of each turn, other creatures within 10 meters of you that can see you must each succeed on a Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag> of you until the start of your next turn.

You take [1] to ward yourself or an ally. When the warded target is brought below half of their total health, they gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRIPS_MARK_EXANIMATE">Exanimate's Glory</LSTag> for two turns.
You are warded by a Sin Eater's bloody penance, if you go below half of your total max health you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRIPS_MARK_EXANIMATE">Exanimate's Glory</LSTag> for two turns.
Deal an additional [1] on attacks or spells, but you take [3] yourself when you use this feature. When this effect wears off, restore [2] of health.

You repent for the depths of your sins. You gain flight, and at the end of each turn, each enemy that you can see must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or receive <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRIPS_FLAGGELANT_WOUNDS">Flagellant's Wounds</LSTag> for two turns. You gain <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Trips_Flaggelant_Vulnerability_Player">Flagellant's Exhilaration</LSTag> for the duration of the penance.
Penance of the Sin Eater Aura

At the end of each turn, other creatures within 10 meters of you that can see you must each succeed on a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or receive <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRIPS_FLAGGELANT_WOUNDS">Flagellant's Wounds</LSTag> for two turns. You gain <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Trips_Flaggelant_Vulnerability_Player">Flagellant's Exhilaration</LSTag> for the duration of the penance.
You take [1] and do an additional [1] when you hit those afflicted by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRIPS_FLAGGELANT_WOUNDS">Flagellant's Wounds</LSTag>.
You are hurt more deeply by attacks.
A stronger connection to your ancestral ties has allowed you to manifest your wings at will.
You have transformed into a manifestation of your celestial ancestry.
Once per turn, you may call upon your celestial power to deal an additional [1] on a successful attack.
Once per turn, you may call upon your celestial power to deal an additional [1] on a successful attack.
Once per turn, you may call upon your flaggelant powers to deal an additional [1] on a successful attack. You also inflict [3] to yourself.
